name: Go
description: Go is a statically typed, compiled, concurrent programming language inspired by C syntax, but with memory safety and garbage collection. It was developed by Google and its initial designers were Robert Griesemer, Rob Pike, and Ken Thompson.

frameworks.name: Gin
frameworks.description: A fast, minimalistic HTTP web framework for Go that offers great performance and a simple API for building web services and microservices.

frameworks.name: Echo
frameworks.description: A high-performance, extensible web framework for Go that makes it easy to build robust and scalable web applications.

frameworks.name: Beego
frameworks.description: A full-featured and high-performance framework for Go, inspired by Django and Python, which includes features like ORM, auto-compilation, and configuration API.

frameworks.name: Revel
frameworks.description: A high-level web framework for Go that promotes rapid development with a clean project structure and a focus on developer productivity.

frameworks.name: Fiber
frameworks.description: Inspired by Express.js, Fiber is a very fast and lightweight web framework for Go, designed to ease the development of web applications.

frameworks.name: Mux
frameworks.description: An HTTP router for Go that offers pattern-based routing and middleware, ideal for creating RESTful APIs.

frameworks.name: Buffalo
frameworks.description: A complete ecosystem for building web applications in Go, which includes generators, front-end support, and development tools.

frameworks.name: Chi
frameworks.description: A lightweight and fast HTTP router for Go that enables creating RESTful APIs and handling middleware efficiently.

frameworks.name: Iris
frameworks.description: A fast, efficient web framework for Go with many features, including support for WebSockets and HTTP/2.

frameworks.name: Martini
frameworks.description: A minimalistic web framework for Go that offers a simple and easy-to-use API, ideal for creating microservices and lightweight web applications.

name: Java
description: Java is a high-level, class-based, object-oriented programming language designed to have as few implementation dependencies as possible. It is a general-purpose programming language intended to let application developers write once, run anywhere (WORA), meaning that compiled Java code can run on all platforms that support Java without the need for recompilation.

frameworks.name: Spring
frameworks.description: A comprehensive framework for enterprise applications, providing a wide range of functionalities from dependency injection to aspect-oriented programming.

frameworks.name: Hibernate
frameworks.description: An object-relational mapping (ORM) framework for Java, facilitating the conversion of data between incompatible type systems using object-oriented programming languages.

frameworks.name: Struts
frameworks.description: A framework for building web applications based on the Model-View-Controller (MVC) architecture.

frameworks.name: JSF (JavaServer Faces)
frameworks.description: A framework for building user interfaces for web applications, providing a component-based approach to the design and implementation of UIs.

frameworks.name: GWT (Google Web Toolkit)
frameworks.description: A development toolkit for building and optimizing complex browser-based applications.

frameworks.name: Vaadin
frameworks.description: A framework for building modern web applications in Java, providing a rich set of UI components.

frameworks.name: Play Framework
frameworks.description: A web application framework which follows the MVC pattern, emphasizing scalability and productivity.

frameworks.name: Grails
frameworks.description: A framework that leverages the Groovy language and offers a high productivity environment by following the 'convention over configuration' principle.

frameworks.name: Apache Wicket
frameworks.description: A component-based web application framework that focuses on simplifying the development of dynamic web applications.

frameworks.name: Dropwizard
frameworks.description: A framework for developing RESTful web services, combining a set of stable, mature libraries in a simple and lightweight package.

name: C#
description: C# is a modern, object-oriented, and type-safe programming language developed by Microsoft. It is designed to be simple, modern, and versatile, suitable for a wide range of applications, including web, mobile, desktop, and cloud-based applications.

frameworks.name: .NET
frameworks.description: A comprehensive development platform for building applications across web, mobile, desktop, and cloud environments.

frameworks.name: ASP.NET
frameworks.description: A framework for building web applications and services with .NET and C#.

frameworks.name: Xamarin
frameworks.description: A framework for building cross-platform mobile applications using C# and .NET.

frameworks.name: Entity Framework
frameworks.description: An object-relational mapper (ORM) that enables .NET developers to work with a database using .NET objects.

frameworks.name: Blazor
frameworks.description: A framework for building interactive web UIs using C# instead of JavaScript.

frameworks.name: Unity
frameworks.description: A cross-platform game engine used for developing 2D and 3D video games and simulations.

frameworks.name: MAUI (Multi-platform App UI)
frameworks.description: A framework for creating native cross-platform applications with a single codebase.

frameworks.name: NancyFX
frameworks.description: A lightweight, low-ceremony framework for building HTTP-based services on .NET and Mono.

frameworks.name: MonoGame
frameworks.description: A framework used for creating cross-platform games with .NET.

frameworks.name: Avalonia
frameworks.description: A cross-platform UI framework for .NET, providing a modern, flexible, and high-performance UI toolkit.

name: TypeScript
description: TypeScript is a strict syntactical superset of JavaScript that adds optional static typing to the language. Developed by Microsoft, TypeScript is designed for the development of large applications and transcompiles to JavaScript.

frameworks.name: Angular
frameworks.description: A platform and framework for building single-page client applications using HTML and TypeScript.

frameworks.name: NestJS
frameworks.description: A progressive Node.js framework for building efficient, reliable, and scalable server-side applications.

frameworks.name: Vue.js
frameworks.description: A progressive framework for building user interfaces, integrating TypeScript support in Vue 3.

frameworks.name: React
frameworks.description: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces, with strong TypeScript support for type-checking and component props.

frameworks.name: Next.js
frameworks.description: A React framework that enables functionality such as server-side rendering and generating static websites, with TypeScript support.

frameworks.name: Nuxt.js
frameworks.description: A framework for creating Vue.js applications with support for server-side rendering, static site generation, and TypeScript integration.

frameworks.name: Gatsby
frameworks.description: A React-based framework for building static websites and applications, offering TypeScript support out of the box.

frameworks.name: Svelte
frameworks.description: A component framework that compiles code to highly efficient vanilla JavaScript, with TypeScript support.

frameworks.name: Ember.js
frameworks.description: An opinionated framework for building ambitious web applications, with good support for TypeScript.

frameworks.name: Electron
frameworks.description: A framework for building cross-platform desktop applications using web technologies, with support for TypeScript.

name: Python
description: Python is a high-level, interpreted programming language with dynamic semantics and a focus on code readability. It supports multiple programming paradigms, including procedural, object-oriented, and functional programming. Python is known for its simplicity and versatility, making it popular for web development, scientific computing, data analysis, artificial intelligence, and more.

frameworks.name: Django
frameworks.description: A high-level Python web framework that encourages rapid development and clean, pragmatic design.

frameworks.name: Flask
frameworks.description: A lightweight WSGI web application framework that is easy to get started with and scales up to complex applications.

frameworks.name: Pyramid
frameworks.description: A small, fast, down-to-earth Python web framework that makes real-world web application development and deployment more fun.

frameworks.name: FastAPI
frameworks.description: A modern, fast (high-performance), web framework for building APIs with Python 3.6+ based on standard Python type hints.

frameworks.name: Tornado
frameworks.description: A Python web framework and asynchronous networking library, originally developed at FriendFeed.

frameworks.name: Bottle
frameworks.description: A fast, simple and lightweight WSGI micro web-framework for Python.

frameworks.name: CherryPy
frameworks.description: A minimalist Python web framework, allowing you to build web applications in much the same way you would build any other object-oriented program.

frameworks.name: Web2py
frameworks.description: A full-stack web framework for rapid development of fast, scalable, secure, and portable database-driven web-based applications.

frameworks.name: Hug
frameworks.description: A Python 3 framework that allows you to develop APIs quickly and with less code.

frameworks.name: Dash
frameworks.description: A framework for building analytical web applications. No JavaScript required.

name: SQL
description: SQL (Structured Query Language) is a domain-specific language used in programming and designed for managing data held in a relational database management system (RDBMS) or for stream processing in a relational data stream management system (RDSMS). SQL is particularly useful for handling structured data, i.e., data incorporating relations among entities and variables.

frameworks.name: MySQL
frameworks.description: An open-source relational database management system based on SQL.

frameworks.name: PostgreSQL
frameworks.description: An open-source object-relational database system that uses and extends the SQL language.

frameworks.name: SQLite
frameworks.description: A C-language library that implements a small, fast, self-contained, high-reliability, full-featured, SQL database engine.

frameworks.name: Microsoft SQL Server
frameworks.description: A relational database management system developed by Microsoft.

frameworks.name: Oracle Database
frameworks.description: A multi-model database management system produced and marketed by Oracle Corporation.

frameworks.name: MariaDB
frameworks.description: A community-developed, commercially supported fork of the MySQL relational database management system.

frameworks.name: IBM Db2
frameworks.description: A family of data management products, including database servers, developed by IBM.

frameworks.name: Amazon Aurora
frameworks.description: A MySQL and PostgreSQL-compatible relational database built for the cloud, combining the performance and availability of high-end commercial databases with the simplicity and cost-effectiveness of open-source databases.

frameworks.name: CockroachDB
frameworks.description: A distributed SQL database built on a transactional and strongly-consistent key-value store.

frameworks.name: Firebird
frameworks.description: An open-source SQL relational database management system that runs on Linux, Microsoft Windows, macOS, and several Unix platforms.

name: PHP
description: PHP (Hypertext Preprocessor) is a popular general-purpose scripting language especially suited to web development. Fast, flexible, and pragmatic, PHP powers everything from your blog to the most popular websites in the world.

frameworks.name: Laravel
frameworks.description: A web application framework with expressive, elegant syntax, aiming to take the pain out of development by easing common tasks.

frameworks.name: Symfony
frameworks.description: A set of reusable PHP components and a PHP framework for web projects.

frameworks.name: CodeIgniter
frameworks.description: A powerful PHP framework with a very small footprint, designed for developers who need a simple and elegant toolkit to create full-featured web applications.

frameworks.name: Zend Framework
frameworks.description: An open-source, object-oriented web application framework implemented in PHP 7.

frameworks.name: Yii
frameworks.description: A high-performance PHP framework best for developing web applications.

frameworks.name: Phalcon
frameworks.description: A full-stack PHP framework delivered as a C-extension, optimized for high performance.

frameworks.name: CakePHP
frameworks.description: A rapid development framework for PHP that provides an extensible architecture for developing, maintaining, and deploying applications.

frameworks.name: Slim
frameworks.description: A PHP micro-framework that helps you quickly write simple yet powerful web applications and APIs.

frameworks.name: Lumen
frameworks.description: A micro-framework by Laravel, ideal for creating fast microservices and APIs.

frameworks.name: FuelPHP
frameworks.description: A simple, flexible, community-driven PHP 5.4+ framework, born from the best ideas of other frameworks.

name: JavaScript
description: JavaScript is a versatile, high-level, interpreted programming language that is a core technology of the web, enabling interactive web pages. It is a key component of web applications, alongside HTML and CSS, and supports event-driven, functional, and imperative programming styles.

frameworks.name: React
frameworks.description: A JavaScript library for building user interfaces, maintained by Facebook.

frameworks.name: Angular
frameworks.description: A platform and framework for building single-page client applications using HTML and JavaScript.

frameworks.name: Vue.js
frameworks.description: A progressive framework for building user interfaces, designed to be incrementally adoptable.

frameworks.name: Node.js
frameworks.description: A JavaScript runtime built on Chrome's V8 JavaScript engine, used for building server-side applications.

frameworks.name: Express.js
frameworks.description: A minimal and flexible Node.js web application framework that provides a robust set of features for web and mobile applications.

frameworks.name: Next.js
frameworks.description: A React framework that enables server-side rendering and static site generation for React applications.

frameworks.name: Meteor
frameworks.description: A full-stack platform for building web and mobile applications in pure JavaScript.

frameworks.name: Svelte
frameworks.description: A framework that compiles JavaScript components into highly efficient imperative code.

frameworks.name: Backbone.js
frameworks.description: A JavaScript library that provides the minimal structure needed for web applications by providing models with key-value binding and custom events.

frameworks.name: Ember.js
frameworks.description: An opinionated framework for building ambitious web applications with a focus on convention over configuration.

name: Rust
description: Rust is a systems programming language focused on safety, speed, and concurrency. It achieves memory safety without using a garbage collector, leveraging a unique ownership model. Rust is known for its performance and its ability to prevent common programming errors, making it a popular choice for system-level programming and high-performance applications.

frameworks.name: Actix
frameworks.description: A powerful, pragmatic, and extremely fast web framework for Rust.

frameworks.name: Rocket
frameworks.description: A web framework for Rust that makes it simple to write fast and secure web applications.

frameworks.name: Warp
frameworks.description: A super-easy, composable, and fast web framework for building APIs with Rust.

frameworks.name: Tide
frameworks.description: A minimal and pragmatic Rust web application framework built for rapid development.

frameworks.name: Gotham
frameworks.description: A flexible web framework that promotes stability, safety, and security for Rust applications.

frameworks.name: Yew
frameworks.description: A modern Rust framework for creating multi-threaded front-end web apps with WebAssembly.

frameworks.name: Tera
frameworks.description: A template engine for Rust inspired by Jinja2 and Django templates.

frameworks.name: SeaORM
frameworks.description: An asynchronous and dynamic ORM for Rust, focused on providing a simple API for database interactions.

frameworks.name: Diesel
frameworks.description: A safe, extensible ORM and Query Builder for Rust, designed to work with PostgreSQL, MySQL, and SQLite.

frameworks.name: Sqlx
frameworks.description: An async, pure Rust SQL crate featuring compile-time checked queries and runtime performance.

name: C
description: C is a general-purpose, procedural programming language that provides low-level access to memory and is known for its efficiency and performance. Developed in the early 1970s, C has had a significant impact on many modern programming languages and remains widely used in system and application programming.

frameworks.name: GLFW
frameworks.description: A library for creating windows with OpenGL contexts and managing input.

frameworks.name: GTK
frameworks.description: A multi-platform toolkit for creating graphical user interfaces.

frameworks.name: Qt
frameworks.description: A free and open-source widget toolkit for creating graphical user interfaces.

frameworks.name: CUnit
frameworks.description: A lightweight system for writing, administering, and running unit tests in C.

frameworks.name: libcurl
frameworks.description: A library for transferring data with URLs.

frameworks.name: ncurses
frameworks.description: A library that provides functions to write text-based user interfaces.

frameworks.name: OpenGL
frameworks.description: A cross-language, cross-platform API for rendering 2D and 3D vector graphics.

frameworks.name: SDL
frameworks.description: A library used to handle graphics, sound, and input for multimedia applications.

frameworks.name: Boost C++ Libraries
frameworks.description: A set of libraries for C++ that extends the standard library with additional functionality.

frameworks.name: ACE (Adaptive Communicative Environment)
frameworks.description: A framework for developing portable, high-performance, and real-time distributed applications.

name: Kotlin
description: Kotlin is a statically-typed programming language developed by JetBrains. It is designed to be fully interoperable with Java and to improve upon the limitations of Java, with a focus on conciseness, safety, and tooling support. Kotlin is used for Android development, server-side applications, and more.

frameworks.name: Ktor
frameworks.description: A Kotlin framework for building asynchronous servers and clients in connected systems.

frameworks.name: Spring Boot
frameworks.description: A popular Java framework that is fully compatible with Kotlin, allowing for concise and expressive application development.

frameworks.name: Exposed
frameworks.description: A SQL framework for Kotlin, allowing for type-safe database access and object-relational mapping.

frameworks.name: Anko
frameworks.description: A Kotlin library that simplifies Android development with less boilerplate code.

frameworks.name: Arrow
frameworks.description: A library for functional programming in Kotlin, providing abstractions like monads, functors, and more.

frameworks.name: Kodein
frameworks.description: A dependency injection library for Kotlin, providing a flexible and powerful DI solution.

frameworks.name: TornadoFX
frameworks.description: A lightweight JavaFX framework for Kotlin, making it easy to create desktop applications with a modern UI.

frameworks.name: KorGE
frameworks.description: A game engine for Kotlin, designed for building multiplatform games.

frameworks.name: Moxy
frameworks.description: A popular library for Android that helps in implementing MVP (Model-View-Presenter) architecture with Kotlin.

frameworks.name: Koin
frameworks.description: A lightweight dependency injection framework for Kotlin, designed for simplicity and ease of use.
